center_name: Grunin Center for Law and Social Entrepreneurship
description: The only center of its kind in a U.S. law school, dedicated to social entrepreneurship, impact investing, and sustainable development.
Joint center between the law school and Columbia Climate School focused on sustainable investment and development.
Focuses on reconciling free market capitalism with democratic values, including ESG and stakeholder theory.

center_name: Social Enterprise and Nonprofit Clinic Program
description: Supports the Social Enterprise & Nonprofit Law Clinic with research and programming.
Offers comprehensive programming including annual symposium on innovation, sustainability, and law.

center_name: Berkeley Center for Law and Business
description: Includes social enterprise programming and executive education on ESG.
Frames issues in business and innovation in terms of serving society, including social mobility and human development.

center_name: CUBE: The Center for Urban Business Entrepreneurship
description: Offers opportunities for students to work with businesses, startups, and social entrepreneurs.

center_name: Program on the Corporation Law and Global Society
description: Aims to expand the corporate law paradigm and shape corporations to contribute to a more just global order.
Incubator space and think tank devoted to addressing global sustainability challenges through policy and research.
Focuses on environmental sustainability and development law.

center_name: Program in Law and Public Service
description: Includes programming on corporate responsibility and social impact.
